[http://www.ekahau.com/userData/ekahau/documents/datasheets/B4_datasheet_letter.pdf Datasheet] This tag is designed to be used with '''Ekahau''''s Wi-Fi '''''RTLS''''' (real-time location system). Per the datasheet, features include... *naturally, real-time location reporting to their controller server ('''ERC''') and privileged users (via '''Ekahau''' ''Vision'' or something else [via XML API]) *OLED text display for text messaging *audio buzzers and two LEDs for alerts *a duress / panic switch (pull out the unit's top ''hook'', [http://www.ekahau.com/real-time-location-system/technology/wi-fi-tags shown used with a lanyard]) *a motion detector for an auto ''man down'' alert Per the FCC docs.. *"Ekahau T401BD", "rev 4.3", "(C) Roving Networks" is silkscreened on the screen side of the board. *Per the block diagram, the device is using a '''G2 Microsystems''' G2C547 b/g WiFi SoC and a [http://www.renesas.com/request?SCREEN_ID=ViewDocumentList&EXECUTE_ACTION=search&LAYER_ID=1686&PART_NO=R5F21258SNFP '''Renesas''' R5F21258 (R5F21258SNFP) - ''R8C/Tiny'' series CPU core - MCU] **Per [http://documentation.renesas.com/doc/products/mpumcu/rej03b0117_r8c2425ds.pdf '''Renesas''''s datasheet], the R5F21258SNFP has 64 KB Program ROM, ''1 KB x 2'' Data flash, and 3 KB RAM. Additional specifications, per '''Ekahau''''s datasheet, follow... *Battery: 600mAh Li-Poly battery, rated for 300 cycles w/ > 70% of initial capacity, 2 hr charge time **''The badges use a high-energy, rechargable battery that works for weeks (depending on location update interval) without recharging). The battery can be charged using individual desk chargers or a rack charger which can charge up to 10 tags at a time.'' *Tx Putput Power: +12dBm *Recieve Sensitivity: -93dBm @ 1Mbps (?? PER / BER) *Typical Operating Range **Open space: 330ft / 100m @ 11Mbps, 500ft / 150m @ 2Mbps **Closed office: 140ft / 40m @ 11Mbps, 200ft / 60m @ 2Mbps *Weight: [[Weight::46 g]] / 1.7 oz *Dimensions: [[Dimensions::60 mm x 90 mm x 8.5 mm]] The 00:18:8E OUI is per the FCC EUT's label. It may not be representative of in-use devices.
